episode_summary: This episode covers a range of quirky and fascinating topics, including a posthumous appearance by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle, Dutch trains using lasers to clear leaves, the malaria-repelling properties of chickens, and the six-toed sandals of the Pueblo people.

facts.fact: On July 13, 1930, Sir Arthur Conan Doyle headlined a show at the Royal Albert Hall, despite having died six days before.
Dutch trains are fitted with lasers to fire at leaves on the line.
To avoid catching malaria, you should carry a chicken with you at all times.
All of the sandals worn by the Pueblo people of New Mexico had enough space for six toes.
